result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin J Walin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -Fine to be paid within 30 days. Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin J Walin

records.addlTxt:
1:44 PM Attorney Matthew Huppertz for Alexander R. Huppertz in court for Justin J Walin.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appears by authorization. 
Case called for plea and sentencing.
Prosecuting attorney moves to amend to Theft contrary to section 13.102(c)(12)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Court finds the defendant guilty.
 

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
FINE: $ 267.50
	
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid within 30 days .   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.
Letter to Court regarding community service
Defendant's AODA Assessment, filed by Atty. Huppertz

10:05 AM Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin J Walin not in court.  Attorney Matthew Huppertz for Alexander R. Huppertz in court for Justin J Walin. 
Defense requests plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:51 AM Attorney Alexander R. Huppertz in court.   Defendant Justin J Walin did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Julian Marrufo, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.
Defense has received discovery and an offer.  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
